intro: Venidium microcephalum, commonly known as the small-headed venidium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant features slender stems and small, triangular leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and are usually greenish-white in color. Venidium microcephalum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
